thread.title: Ink attack on Kulkarni unjustified: instaVaani poll
thread.title_full: Ink attack on Kulkarni unjustified: instaVaani poll - Livemint

author: Livemint
title: Ink attack on Kulkarni unjustified: instaVaani poll
text:
Monday’s attack on columnist and former Bharatiya Janata Party ideologue Sudheendra Kulkarni, who had his face smeared with black ink by Shiv Sena activists, was unjustified, according to an InstaVaani poll of 516 people spread across all the metros. 
Of the 405 people who answered a specific question on the attack, which has been seen as an illustration of growing intolerance, 63% said the attack wasn’t justified while 37% thought otherwise, the poll found. Kulkarni was attacked for organizing an event at which former Pakistan foreign minister Khurshid Mahmud Kasuri’s new book was launched in Mumbai. 
Click here for enlarge When instaVaani asked respondents if they thought cultural ties between India and Pakistan should continue despite bilateral tensions, 52% of 402 respondents replied in the negative and 48% said they should continue. And asked if such incidents would polarize the country, 54% of 357 respondents replied in the affirmative; 46% said otherwise.
